SEARCH
Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.eremin.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.eremin.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impler, JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements JarImpler
API for implementing Java interfaces.

Leveraging java.lang.reflect API to implement a class for the interface specified. Generated methods will return corresponding type default value.

impl-source

Is a java source code file that being generated by this class, more exact, by implement(Class, Path) method.

impl-class

Is a java class bytecode file that being generated by this class, more exact, it's impl-class that was compiled.

  • Method Details

    • unicodeEscape

      private static String unicodeEscape(String str)
      Converts unicode string to unicode escaped string.

      For each character in provided string, either ads it with no change if basic ASCII, or converts it to \\uxxxx (excluding escape slashes) format if not.

      Example: šđčćasdf -> \\u0161\\u0111\\u010d\\u0107asdf (excluding escape slashes) (may not be visible at render, but it's escaped)

      Parameters:
      str - String that is unicode escaped.
      Returns:
      String with unicode characters escaped.
      Since:
      2.1
      See Also:
      • Unicode in Java
      • ASCII

    • deleteDirectory

      private static void deleteDirectory(Path dir)
      Deletes directory.

      Utility function that silently deletes directory. Meaning that regardless of the success, produces nothing whatsoever.

      Parameters:
      dir - Path of the directory to delete.
      See Also:
      • File.delete()

    • getImplName

      private static String getImplName(Class<?> token, boolean canonical)
      Returns name for generated impl-source.

      Behavior varies based on canonical option:

      • True: package.name.class-simple-nameImpl
      • False: class-simple-nameImpl
      Parameters:
      token - Class for which 'Impl'-ended name should be generated.
      canonical - Decides whether resulting name contains package name.
      Returns:
      Provided Class name with Impl suffix.
      Since:
      1.0

    • getImplPath

      private static Path getImplPath(Class<?> token, Path root, boolean isClass)
      Returns Path of getImplName(Class, boolean) relative to root.

      Extension of file is deducted from isClass option:

      • True: /.../class-impl-name.class
      • False: /.../class-impl-name.java
      Parameters:
      token - Class for which 'Impl'-ended path should be generated.
      root - Package root of generated impl-source.
      isClass - Decides whether resulting path targets java-source or class-bytecode.
      Returns:
      Path to generated impl-source file.
      Since:
      1.0

    • tabulate

      private static String tabulate(String str, int amount)
      Tabulates the whole string with tabs.

      tab is just SPACE repeated TABSTOP times.

      Replaces each new-line with NEW_LINE + tab, trims latest tab if resulting String ends with it.

      Resulted String then concated to another tab, so the first line would be indented too.

      Parameters:
      str - String to tabulate.
      amount - Number of tabs prefixed before each line.
      Returns:
      the same String, but tabulated.
      Since:
      1.0

    • generateDefaultValue

      private static String generateDefaultValue(Class<?> type)
      Generates default return value for Class (type) specified.

      Default values:

      • void: EMPTY
      • boolean: false
      • Non-primitives: null
      • Otherwise: 0

      Returned string is eligible to be used as return value, see generateMethodReturn(Method).

      Parameters:
      type - Class which default values should be generated.
      Returns:
      String representing type's default value.
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Primitive Data Types

    • generateMethodThrows

      private static String generateMethodThrows(Method method)
      Generates a throws clause for specified method.

      Generated result is EMPTY, if Method doesn't throw anything.

      Returned string is eligible to be used as method's throws clause, see generateMethodSignature(Method).

      Parameters:
      method - Method for witch generation is performed.
      Returns:
      String representing method's throws clause.
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Throws Clause

    • generateMethodParameters

      private static String generateMethodParameters(Method method)
      Generates the arguments clause for specified method.

      Returned string is eligible to be used as method's arguments clause, see generateMethodSignature(Method).

      Parameters:
      method - Method for witch generation is performed.
      Returns:
      String representing method's arguments clause.
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Passing Information to a Method

    • generateMethodSignature

      private static String generateMethodSignature(Method method)
      Generates signature of the specified method.

      Generates public override of an interface's method, i.e. 

       @Override
 public (type) method(arguments clause) (throws clause) {

      Method's body should be written right after this statement.

      Parameters:
      method - Method for witch generation is performed.
      Returns:
      String representing method signature.
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Defining Methods

    • generateMethodReturn

      private static String generateMethodReturn(Method method)
      Generates body as return statement compiling with the return type of the specified method.

      Returned string is eligible to be used as method's body, see writeMethods(Writer, Class).

      Parameters:
      method - Method for witch generation is performed.
      Returns:
      String representing method return statement.
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Returning a Value from a Method.

    • writeMethods

      private static void writeMethods(Writer writer, Class<?> token) throws IOException
      Writes down methods implementations of the specified interface.

      Each method defined as following: 

       (method signature)
  (method body)
 }

      Resulting into well written java class body, see implement(Class, Path).

      Parameters:
      writer - Writer of currently generating impl-source.
      token - Class for which generation is performed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
      Since:
      1.0

    • writePackageStatement

      private static void writePackageStatement(Writer writer, Class<?> token) throws IOException
      Writes down the package statement of the specified interface implementation.

      Uses the same package as specified interface. If specified interface doesn't belong to any package does nothing.

      Resulting into well written java package statement, see implement(Class, Path).

      Note: this must be the first line in the generated impl-source.

      Parameters:
      writer - Writer of currently generating impl-source.
      token - Class for which generation is performed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Creating a Package

    • writeClassDeclaration

      private static void writeClassDeclaration(Writer writer, Class<?> token) throws IOException
      Writes down the declaration of the implementation of specified interface.

      Writes public Class that implements interface specified, i.e. 

       public class interface-nameImpl implements interface-name {

      Resulting into well written java class declaration, see implement(Class, Path).

      Parameters:
      writer - Writer of currently generating impl-source.
      token - Class for which generation is performed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Declaring Classes

    • loadClass

      private static Class<?> loadClass(String className) throws ImplerException
      Loads the class with the specified binary name.

      It is invoked to resolve class references, as creating target, it's allowing implement(Class, Path) to work through them.

      Parameters:
      className - String is name of class that should be loaded.
      Returns:
      Class is the resulting reflect object.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If class loading error occurs.
      Since:
      2.0
      See Also:
      • ClassLoader
      • URLClassLoader

    • compile

      private static void compile(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Compiles impl-source of the specified interface to impl-class.

      Compilation of the java source file that was generated by implement(Class, Path) method, relative to code source of the interface it was implementing.

      Resulting impl-class will be located just near the impl-source.

      Resulting impl-class is eligible to be used as a java Jar content, see implementJar(Class, Path).

      Using StandardCharsets.UTF_8 as JavaCompiler encoding.

      ProtectionDomain's CodeSource of the specified interface is being used as JavaCompiler classpath.

      Parameters:
      token - Class for which impl-source compilation is performed.
      root - Path is root relative to which impl-source is located.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If an error during compilation occurs.
      Since:
      2.0

    • makeJar

      private static void makeJar(Class<?> token, Path root, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Makes Jar file out of impl-class, and writes it to the path specified.

      Being run after impl-source generation and it's compilation. Takes impl-class and packs in into a Jar file.

      Manifest of the resulting Jar is being:

      • Manifest-Version = 1.0
      • Main-Class = (binary name of the impl-class)
      Parameters:
      token - Class of impl-class that will be packed inside Jar.
      root - Path is root relative to which impl-class is located.
      jarFile - Path is the location of the newly made Jar.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If an error occurs during Jar creation.
      Since:
      2.0

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Entry point for the Implementor application.

      In both modes interface that shall be implemented is resolved relative to the CWD (Current Working Directory).

      Jar-mode:

       -jar (interface to implement) (output jar file)
      Generates implementation for the specified (as first positional argument) interface and packs it into Jar. Resulting Jar location is specified by the second positional argument.

      Default:

       (interface to implement)
      Generates implementation for the specified (as first positional argument) interface, and writes it just near that specified interface.
      Parameters:
      args - String[] command line arguments.
      Since:
      2.0

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Implements the specified interface.

      Creates the impl-source just near the interface it shall implement.

      Created implementation is a well written java code, meaning it's compilable, i.e. 

       (package statement)

 (class declaration)
      (class body)
 }

      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      token - Class for which implementation is performed.
      root - Path is root relative to which specified interface is located.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If an error during implementation occurs.
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      • Implementing an Interface

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Implements the specified interface and packs it into the Jar.

      By compiling impl-source, the resulted impl-class is then being packed and delivered as Jar to the desired destination.

      In the process, generated files are being stored at a temp directory, that will be after process completion deleted.

      Produces .jar file implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - Class for which implementation is performed.
      jarFile - Path is the location of an output Jar.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If an error during Jar implementation occurs.
      Since:
      2.0
      See Also:
      • Packaging Programs in JAR - Using JAR-related APIs
